summary:
Introduction to penetration testing phases, recon, scanning, exploitation, and reporting. Learn the fundamentals of ethical hacking and penetration testing.  Understand the penetration testing methodology including reconnaissance, scanning, enumeration, exploitation, post-exploitation, and reporting. The lesson includes detailed explanations, visual aids, and assessment tools to ensure mastery of the concepts.

This topic provides essential knowledge for understanding cybersecurity at the Secondary level. Through comprehensive study, students will develop a deep understanding of the concepts, principles, and applications related to Ethical Hacking Basics. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in real-world contexts. This topic provides comprehensive coverage essential for understanding cybersecurity at the intermediate level. Through detailed study, students will gain deep insights into the concepts, principles, and real-world applications. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in various contexts.
why_it_matters: This programming/technology topic provides practical skills highly sought after in the job market and enables you to build real-world applications and solve technical problems.

assignments.title: Research Assignment: Ethical Hacking Basics

Identify and explain at least three key concepts from the topic
Find one real-world example or application of these concepts
Write a 300-500 word summary explaining your findings
